posts.post_content:
Possibly better than Juzam Djinn - this guy is a real bruiser. It's a pity he didn't get a fair shot, though, since he was in such a bounce-heavy standard environment. And of course, bounce is his main weakness.
  
   
All the same, he looks mighty cool. I can imagine that shield shooting lasers out of its eyes.

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (3/6/2010 4:14:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@makochman:  
One could argue whether [Juzám Djinn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juzám Djinn) or *Phyrexian Scuta* is better.  
Generally the Djinn will be worse after your fourth upkeep, before that you'll have lost your life slower so if you just need him for two attacks he's preferable.  
This would only be the case though if you assume that either...  
-your opponent will have used removal on him in time (which, albeit annoying, sounds quite plausible)  
-you have won the game at that point (which is unlikely)  
-you have some way to get rid of him (which would be dumb)  
-you have some way to prevent the damage, like [Personal Sanctuary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Personal Sanctuary) (which is the only case where i'd prefer Juzám).  
  
The Scuta has more upsides by himself:  
-he can also be played as a [Hill Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hill Giant) if you don't need him to be 5/5, or if you don't want or can't even afford to lose any life, making him more flexible.  
Further deck-specific advantages:  
-he costs just one black mana. That makes him easier to cast... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Generally the Djinn will be worse after your fourth upkeep, before that you'll have lost your life slower so if you just need him for two attacks he's preferable.
This would only be the case though if you assume that either...
-your opponent will have used removal on him in time (which, albeit annoying, sounds quite plausible)
-you have won the game at that point (which is unlikely)
-you have some way to get rid of him (which would be dumb)
-you have some way to prevent the damage, like Personal Sanctuary (which is the only case where i'd prefer Juzám).

The Scuta has more upsides by himself:
-he can also be played as a Hill Giant if you don't need him to be 5/5, or if you don't want or can't even afford to lose any life, making him more flexible.
Further deck-specific advantages:
-he costs just one black mana. That makes him easier to cast... (see all)

posts.post_content: I use 4 of them in my green/black land destruction deck, I can usually get it out second turn with the use of Dark Ritual, pay the kicker and now my opponent has to deal with a 5/5 creature when they will in all likelyhood have only two lands, it buys me time for my Argothian Wurms or Spiritmongers, and seeing as it's a land destruction deck I can usually make sure they will have a hard time dealing with the Scuta... counterspells are a pain though.....

posts.post_content: This sits in my black zombie deck, useful on occasion, and often worth the life to make bigger. That said, I happen to play in an enviornment with lots and lots of bounce ( [Reality Strobe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reality Strobe) ) but for its mana cost, it is still a decent zombie. It makes a good example of Black's 'pay life for power' theme.
